descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the third and final quarter of the Beginning German sequence: a systematic introduction to basic German. All four language skills-speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing-are stressed to insure that students acquire a basic command of German. Classes are conducted in German, except when explanations of grammar or other material require the use of English.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Students must have successfully completed German 101-2. Graduate Students should kindly request a permission number from the department.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will have achieved enough proficiency in German to advance to the intermediate level.
